intro: Ammi ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert cowbane, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers are accompanied by fern-like leaves. Ammi ehrenbergii is also noted for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to livestock and humans.
